pageContext.claim: “I don't really [think we are seeing a rise in white nationalism]. I think it's a small group of people that have very, very serious problems, I guess. If you look what happened in New Zealand, perhaps that's the case. I don't know enough about it yet … But it's certainly a terrible thing.”
pageContext.analysis: The alleged gunman cited Trump as "a symbol of renewed white identity and common purpose." Since Trump's election, several reports have shown an uptick far-right violence and violent acts by white supremacists.
